data.title: Dorothy Dandridge
data.text:
AKA Dorothy Jean Dandridge

Born: 9-Nov-1922

Birthplace: Cleveland, OH

Died: 8-Sep-1965

Location of death: West Hollywood, CA

Cause of death: Accident - Overdose

Remains: Cremated, Forest Lawn Memorial Park Cemetery, Glendale, CA

Gender: Female

Race or Ethnicity: Black

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: Carmen Jones

Father: Cyrus Dandridge

Mother: Ruby Dandridge (actress, b. 1-Mar-1899, d. 17-Oct-1987)

Sister: Vivian Dandridge (b. 22-Apr-1921, d. 1991 stroke)

Husband: Harold Nicholas (tapdancer, m. 6-Sep-1942, div. Oct-1951, one child)

Daughter: Harolyn (b. with brain injury)

Husband: Jack Denison (m. 22-Jun-1959, div. 20-Dec-1962)

Boyfriend: Peter Lawford (actor)

Boyfriend: Otto Preminger (film director)

Boyfriend: Phil Moore (composer, 1930's or 1940's)

High School: Thomas Jefferson High School, Los Angeles, CA (dropped out)

Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame 1977

Hollywood Walk of Fame 6719 Hollywood Blvd.

Endorsement of Quaker Oats Rice-A-Roni (1962)

Bankruptcy 1963

Autopsy

Risk Factors: Depression, Alcoholism

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

Malaga (26-Jan-1960)

Porgy and Bess (24-Jun-1959)

The Decks Ran Red (10-Oct-1958) · Mahia

Tamango (24-Jan-1958)

Island in the Sun (12-Jun-1957)

Carmen Jones (5-Oct-1954) · Carmen Jones

Remains to be Seen (15-May-1953) · Herself

Bright Road (17-Apr-1953) · Jane Richards

The Harlem Globetrotters (30-May-1951) · Ann Carpenter

Tarzan's Peril (13-Mar-1951) · Melmendi

Atlantic City (29-Jul-1944) · Herself

Hit Parade of 1943 (26-Mar-1943)

Sundown (20-Oct-1941) · Kipsang's Wife

Sun Valley Serenade (21-Aug-1941)

Lady from Louisiana (22-Apr-1941)

The Big Broadcast of 1936 (20-Sep-1935)
